result.execSummary:
The defendant Rita L Bolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs, fees, and surcharges associated with the action. 

--To pay restitution of $609.50 payable to US Bank

--To pay the applicable DNA surcharge.

--To pay costs, fees, and surcharges associated with the action.
--Engage in legitimate attempts to obtain/maintain employment and engage in education as deemed necessary and appropriate by your Agent

--Maintain absolute sobriety (Including not to consume alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription; take all other prescription drugs that are deemed necessary and appropriate as authorized by the Agent.)

--No contact with Carol Courtright.

--Contact with Crystal Williams if it is agreeable with her. This is on an incident by incident basis.  The Court notes for the record that Miss Williams is presents and has requested contact with Miss Bolden at this time.  If at any time during probation, Ms. Williams changes her mind, she may simply so indicate.  Thereafter, contact would be considered a violation of conditions of probation.

--Court orders Miss Bolden to report forthwith to JESO for booking. 

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment beyond the methadone program if the Agent deems it necessary and appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The Court converts all outstanding costs to civil judgment. (Restitution Surcharge)

Count #2 nunc pro tunc 6/7/18.

[MK] case called at 2:09pm.
Defendant Rita L Bolden appears via videoconferencing from the Robert E Ellsworth Correctional Institution, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Ms. Bolden that videoconferencing system-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Hall gives argument in opposition to Ms. Bolden's Petition for Sentence Adjustment. 
Ms. Bolden makes a statement. 
The Court grants the Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  
recess 2:17pm.
Sentence adjustment review on June 7, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

DOC Balance Inquiry

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:

Case called at 10:15am [ma]
Defendant Rita L Bolden in court, in custody  with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1: The Court sentences Rita L Bolden to    18 months , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH  

On Count #2: The Court sentences Rita L Bolden  to 18 months , with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6  months.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to the sentence in Count #1. 


The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   108  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--all conditions are to be at the discretion of the Agent


The Court converts all outstanding costs to civil judgment. 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 10:33am
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements

Case called at 11:30 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Rita L Bolden in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to Misdemeanor Theft, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.05, 939.62(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on AMENDED Count #1 and Count #2 as charged; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2 the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment beyond the methadone program if the Agent deems it necessary and appropriate.
--Maintain absolute sobriety (Including not to consume alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription; take all other prescription drugs that are deemed necessary and appropriate as authorized by the Agent.)
--Engage in legitimate attempts to obtain/maintain employment and engage in education as deemed necessary and appropriate by your Agent
--To pay the applicable DNA surcharge.
--To pay costs, fees, and surcharges associated with the action. 
--To pay restitution of $609.50 payable to US Bank
--No contact with Carol Courtright.
--Contact with Crystal Williams if it is agreeable with her. This is on an incident by incident basis.  The Court notes for the record that Miss Williams is presents and has requested contact with Miss Bolden at this time.  If at any time during probation, Ms. Williams changes her mind, she may simply so indicate.  Thereafter, contact would be considered a violation of conditions of probation. 
--Court orders Miss Bolden to report forthwith to JESO for booking. 

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 12:00 pm
Status conference on June 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2016 at 11:20 am.

Reserve Judge Mawsdley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 8:55am. 
Defendant Rita Bolden in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms.  Bolden waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
ADA Hall files an Information. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court continues the Bond.  
recess 8:57am 
[Post-hearing/off-record Ms. Bolden provides the clerk with her updated address in Beloit, WI.]


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/1/16 at 11:20am,  (2) Status Conference on 6/17/16 at 11:00am

Current: 1845 Church Street, Beloit, WI 53511 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2016)
Prior: 1210 Sylvester St. Apt #1, Janesville, WI 53546 United States
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 8:52am. 
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however the Defendant does not appear and the State does not have any witness present. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he spoke with Ms. Bolden by telephone yesterday and again this morning.  In these conversations, Ms. Bolden indicated that she has not received notice of today's hearing, and she was not able to make transportation arrangements due to shortness of time.
The Court will reschedule the Preliminary Hearing 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.  The Court removes the May 10th FSSC and the May 16th Jury Trial from its calendar. 
The Court continues Bond.  
recess 8:54am. 

NEXT:   rescheduled Preliminary Hearing on May 6th at 8:30am.
Motion hearing on May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
